figure.figDesc: Carrie, et al. "Is disaggregation the holy grail of energy efficiency? The case of electricity." Energy Policy 52 , 2013. (2) Oliver Parson, et al. "Non-Intrusive Load Monitoring Using Prior Models of General Appliance Types", 2012. (3) Arthur, David, and Sergei Vassilvitskii. "k-means++: The advantages of careful seeding." Proceedings of the eighteenth annual ACM-SIAM symposium on Discrete algorithms. Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics, 2007.• Potentially~10% of household energy consumption can be saved by Non- Intrusive Appliance Load Monitoring (NIALM) techniques [1] • Accurate NIALM can lead to better energy policy deployment • Promising due to advent of smart meters (high/low frequency data collection) • Proliferation of smart devices and Internet of Things (IoT) • Appliance state transition is modeled as a Markov Chain with a finite set of states • Individual appliance power load curve as input • Difference HMM algorithm outputs parameters (A, , ) which work as the signature of the appliance • Each state emission modeled as a Gaussian distribution of power usage • Prior distribution of the states ( ), transition matrix (A), and emission matrix ( ) are produced from the curve • Viterbi Algorithm used to determine the most probable sequence of states for each appliance • Disaggregation based on a "Difference" HMM [2] x: Input vector (Total load) y: Hidden variable (Differential load) z: Appliance load • Pecan Street database with +600 household data is used • K-Means++ [3] is used for clustering the consumers into k clusters (k = 5 gives best results) • Successfully clustered households based on energy usage behavior • Recommendations can be given by comparing users from the same cluster after disaggregation task shown above
